bug.short_desc: i.MX6 wandboard kernel crashes when rebooting

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 1157489 Kernel crash dump
Description of problem: Wandboard Quad recently updated to Fedora 24 beta. When doing a reboot, I get a crash when the usb_hcd_irq is freed.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 4.5.4-300.fc24.armv7hl
How reproducible: 100%
Steps to Reproduce: 1. reboot 2. 3.
Actual results: crash
Expected results: no crash
Additional info:

(In reply to Steven A. Falco from comment #0) > Created attachment 1157489 [details] > Kernel crash dump > > Description of problem: Wandboard Quad recently updated to Fedora 24 beta. > When doing a reboot, I get a crash when the usb_hcd_irq is freed.
Can you put the entire crash output please?

I've now attached everything that is printed out from the time I type "reboot".
Once the board prints out the last message shown in the attachment, there is no further output until I press the reset button on the Wandboard.
Is this new dump what you were looking for, or is there something more that I need to provide?
I'll be happy to gather more data - please let me know.
I tried upgrading to the 4.6.0-1.fc25.armv7hl kernel. I get the same crash. I'll attach the log from that kernel too.
Created attachment 1158800 Crash using fc25 kernel

*********** MASS BUG UPDATE **************
We apologize for the inconvenience. There is a large number of bugs to go through and several of them have gone stale. Due to this, we are doing a mass bug update across all of the Fedora 24 kernel bugs.
Fedora 24 has now been rebased to 4.7.4-200.fc24. Please test this kernel update (or newer) and let us know if you issue has been resolved or if it is still present with the newer kernel.
If you have moved on to Fedora 25, and are still experiencing this issue, please change the version to Fedora 25.
If you experience different issues, please open a new bug report for those.
This bug is still present with kernel 4.7.4-200.fc24.armv7hl.
